question: The Pygmy Hog Research and Breeding Centre, is located in which of the following states of India?
explanation: Pygmy Hog (Porcula salvania) is the rarest and smallest wild pig in the world. It is critically endangered animal and is currently found only in Indian state of Assam. The Pygmy Hog Research and Breeding Centre is located in Basistha, Assam, which along with Assam State Zoo is endeavouring captive breeding of this hog.
